intro: Arracacia xanthorrhiza, commonly known as yellow root, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its thick, yellow-orange roots that are rich in alkaloids. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cymes. The plant has been historically used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
